snippet: After months of resisting sending Americans to fight ISIS, President Obama on Thursday night found himself exactly where he did not want to be.
abstract: News analysis; Pres Obama, in sending warplanes back into skies over Iraq, has returned United States to seemingly intractable conflict and signaled bleak reality that America's involvement there has not ended; in doing so, Obama becomes fourth consecutive American president to order military action in Iraq; to longtime opponents of Iraq war, Obama's decision represents step back down dangerous path.
lead_paragraph: After months of resisting sending Americans to fight ISIS, President Obama on Thursday night found himself exactly where he did not want to be.

headline.main: Obama, With Reluctance, Returns to Action in Iraq

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
